topics.name: Orange 16 Reading - Test 3 - Plant ‘thermometer’ triggers springtime growth by measuring night-time heat

words.exampleSentence: Scientists discovered that a specific molecule in plant cells changes its behaviour to sense night-time temperature.
The study focuses on molecular mechanisms that allow plants to respond accurately to environmental temperature changes.
Researchers describe phytochromes as a biological thermometer that allows plants to measure seasonal heat at night.
The thermometric behaviour of phytochromes explains how plants monitor subtle temperature variations.
Climate change increases thermal stress, which significantly reduces crop yields in many agricultural regions.
Crops respond thermally to night-time temperatures rather than daytime sunlight alone.

Phytochromes gauge night-time heat by changing states at speeds proportional to temperature levels.

Scientists compare phytochromes to mercury rising in a thermometer as temperatures increase overnight.

The rate of molecular change is proportional to temperature, directly influencing how fast plants grow.
Growth speed increases proportionally as night-time temperatures rise during warmer seasons.
This research pinpoints the exact molecular process that enables plants to sense temperature.
